Claim: The coronavirus outbreak is caused by 5G technology.
Explaination: There is no causal link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease has been definitively identified in scientific studies as a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The coronavirus outbreak is caused by 5G technology.

Explanation:There is no causal link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease has been definitively identified in scientific studies as a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/viral-claim-falsely-asserts-that-covid-19-is-due-to-5g-technology-rollout-not-a-virus/

Claim: Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg after South Africa announced its first case of novel coronavirus.
Explaination: A statement claiming that Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg due to coronavirus is fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg after South Africa announced its first case of novel coronavirus.

Explanation:A statement claiming that Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg due to coronavirus is fake.

https://pesacheck.org/false-emirates-has-not-suspended-flights-to-johannesburg-due-to-coronavirus-1b9f5e9ea0d1

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: Airport in Karachi suspends all international arrivals during coronavirus epidemic.
Explaination: Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that has circulated about flight suspended at the airport in march 2019
Label: False
html:
Claim: Airport in Karachi suspends all international arrivals during coronavirus epidemic.

Explanation:Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that has circulated about flight suspended at the airport in march 2019

https://factcheck.afp.com/no-all-international-arrivals-were-not-cancelled-airport-karachi-february-2020

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows Italian nationals expressing their gratitude to China for providing aid during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video shows a Belarusian band singing a Chinese song several months before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows Italian nationals expressing their gratitude to China for providing aid during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video shows a Belarusian band singing a Chinese song several months before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-belarusian-band-singing-chinese-song-covid-19-outbreak

Claim: There is a patent for the new coronavirus.
Explaination: A post claiming that the Pirbright Institute in the UK applied for a patent for the novel coronavirus outbreak, but uses documents showing a patent from 2015 that the institute holds for avian influenza virus, which is also a coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a patent for the new coronavirus.

Explanation:A post claiming that the Pirbright Institute in the UK applied for a patent for the novel coronavirus outbreak, but uses documents showing a patent from 2015 that the institute holds for avian influenza virus, which is also a coronavirus.

https://pesacheck.org/false-there-is-no-patent-for-the-2019-ncov-coronavirus-3a13324fa73b

Claim: Audio of Biden calling the coronavirus a hoax.
Explaination: The video was manipulated and is not real.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Audio of Biden calling the coronavirus a hoax.

Explanation:The video was manipulated and is not real.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-audio-of-biden-calling-coronavirus-a-hoax-was-manipulated.html

Claim: Radio host Rush Limbaugh compares novel coronavirus to “the common cold.”
Explaination: Novel coronavirus is more deadly from the viruses that can cause a cold, according to experts.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Radio host Rush Limbaugh compares novel coronavirus to “the common cold.”

Explanation:Novel coronavirus is more deadly from the viruses that can cause a cold, according to experts.

https://factcheck.afp.com/coronavirus-hoax-spreads-online-after-rush-limbaugh-broadcast

Claim: Whether CDC had scheduled announcement that all should wear masks for everyday life.
Explaination: At the time, the CDC confirmed they had nothing scheduled.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether CDC had scheduled announcement that all should wear masks for everyday life.

Explanation:At the time, the CDC confirmed they had nothing scheduled.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-cdc-is-not-scheduled-to-recommend-masks-for-everyday-life.html

Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.
Explaination: Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.

Explanation:Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/10/the-ministry-of-tourism-has-not-issued-any-order-closing-down-restaurants-till-october/

Claim: Officials say coronavirus killed 200 in Iran.
Explaination: The number of deaths in official reports on March 3, 2020, were much lower than stated in this article.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Officials say coronavirus killed 200 in Iran.

Explanation:The number of deaths in official reports on March 3, 2020, were much lower than stated in this article.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471824-fact-check-just-in-coronavirus-kills-200-in-iran.html

Claim: Amid COVID-19 lockdown, the Himalayan Mountain Range is visible from the Puttalam area in Sri Lanka.
Explaination: Himalayan mountain range was visible to Jalandhar area in Punjab(India) after  the improvement in air quality following nationwide lockdown in India.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Amid COVID-19 lockdown, the Himalayan Mountain Range is visible from the Puttalam area in Sri Lanka.

Explanation:Himalayan mountain range was visible to Jalandhar area in Punjab(India) after the improvement in air quality following nationwide lockdown in India.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/06/fact-check-himalayan-mountain-range-visible-to-sri-lanka/

Claim: An audio clip suggests that the WHO has advised a lockdown.
Explaination: A source in WHO confirmed that the organisation has not put out any such information as heard in the viral audio clip.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip suggests that the WHO has advised a lockdown.

Explanation:A source in WHO confirmed that the organisation has not put out any such information as heard in the viral audio clip.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/has-who-suggested-two-month-coronaivrus-lockdown-to-government-fact-check

Claim: Photo of a mannequin being wheeled into a hospital shows the COVID-19 coverup.
Explaination: The picture of the dummy on a stretcher going into a hospital is an actual photo, but it's from the U.S. Navy. It shows sailors practicing transferring patients from a pier in New York City onto the USNS Comfort hospital ship in support of the nation's COVID-19 response efforts.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of a mannequin being wheeled into a hospital shows the COVID-19 coverup.

Explanation:The picture of the dummy on a stretcher going into a hospital is an actual photo, but it's from the U.S. Navy. It shows sailors practicing transferring patients from a pier in New York City onto the USNS Comfort hospital ship in support of the nation's COVID-19 response efforts.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/Fact-Check-Photo-Of-Mannequin-Being-Wheeled-Into-Hospital-Does-NOT-Prove-There-Is-A-Coronavirus-Cover-Up.html

Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.

https://factcheck.afp.com/misleading-claim-circulates-muslims-ignored-covid-19-curfew-sri-lankan-mosque

Claim: Cuban medicine cures COVID-19.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cuban medicine cures COVID-19.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/5-de-17270-2/?fbclid=IwAR3UDAOb0a3epiSuZvdT8XGIYWqdmxFwmpGcfO8p-OoqxIdxCmb3AZozn3E

Claim: COVID-19 is an airborne disease.
Explaination: The World Health Organization has stated that the disease is primarily spread by contact with infected persons and contaminated surfaces where the virus has settled, rather than through the air.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 is an airborne disease.

Explanation:The World Health Organization has stated that the disease is primarily spread by contact with infected persons and contaminated surfaces where the virus has settled, rather than through the air.

https://pesacheck.org/false-there-is-no-evidence-to-show-that-covid-19-is-transmitted-through-the-air-a437c9b82258?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: After COVID-19 outbreak in europe Muslims and non-Muslims have come out in the streets shouting praises for Allah and reading Kalma.
Explaination: Fact Crescendo found the viral video to be unrelated. The video dates back before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Europe. This is a demonstration march by the citizens in Hamburg, Germany in solidarity with Uyghur Muslims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: After COVID-19 outbreak in europe Muslims and non-Muslims have come out in the streets shouting praises for Allah and reading Kalma.

Explanation:Fact Crescendo found the viral video to be unrelated. The video dates back before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Europe. This is a demonstration march by the citizens in Hamburg, Germany in solidarity with Uyghur Muslims.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-people-chanting-allah-hu-akbar-in-europe-after-covid-19-outbreak/

Claim: One can get free masks from the government to fight coronavirus by filling this form in the web link.
Explaination: These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.
Label: False
html:
Claim: One can get free masks from the government to fight coronavirus by filling this form in the web link.

Explanation:These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-dubious-websites-offer-free-masks-on-behalf-of-pm-modi-to-fight-coronavirus-1656153-2020-03-16

Claim: The map is “based on traces of Wuhan citizens,” between the outbreak of the new coronavirus and the blockade of Wuhan.
Explaination: This map is an image showing the routes of passenger aircraft around the world, and it is incorrect to use "maps based on traces of movement"
Label: False
html:
Claim: The map is “based on traces of Wuhan citizens,” between the outbreak of the new coronavirus and the blockade of Wuhan.

Explanation:This map is an image showing the routes of passenger aircraft around the world, and it is incorrect to use "maps based on traces of movement"

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kensukeseya/coronavirus-map

Claim: There is a COVID-19 case in east Indian state.
Explaination: Local health authority said that there are no confirmed novel coronavirus patients in the area at the time.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a COVID-19 case in east Indian state.

Explanation:Local health authority said that there are no confirmed novel coronavirus patients in the area at the time.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-health-authorities-dismiss-hoax-report-novel-coronavirus-case-east-indian-state

Claim: Viral photo in Nigeria suggests former President Obasanjo said there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the minister of health lied.
Explaination: President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. Additionally, Dubawa initiated a google reverse image search, which revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Viral photo in Nigeria suggests former President Obasanjo said there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the minister of health lied.

Explanation:President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. Additionally, Dubawa initiated a google reverse image search, which revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.

https://dubawa.org/and-another-one-what-did-obasanjo-say-about-coronavirus/

Claim: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.
Explaination: The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.

Explanation:The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.

https://myanmar.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-post-claiming-myanmar-former-military-junta-donates-covid-19-fund/

Claim: Chinese police crack down on suspected coronavirus patients.
Explaination: Video is originally from the Hong Kong protests.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese police crack down on suspected coronavirus patients.

Explanation:Video is originally from the Hong Kong protests.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/false-video-shows-police-crackdown-on-suspected-covid-19-patients-in-china-7236

Claim: Says truck drivers are being turned away from fast-food restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Explaination: Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can't fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren't allowed to walk up and order at the window.
Label: Mostly True
html:
Claim: Says truck drivers are being turned away from fast-food restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Explanation:Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can't fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren't allowed to walk up and order at the window.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/26/facebook-posts/some-fast-food-chains-turn-away-truckers-drive-thr/
